subject: Medicine
title: Capacity and Mental Illness
description: A short lesson to help you apply Capacity and Mental Illness.

hook.text: A person with schizophrenia refuses medication. They have the rightâ€”unless they lack capacity to decide.

buildup.text: Mental capacity means the ability to understand, retain, and weigh information to make a decision.

discovery.text: Having a mental illness doesn't automatically mean lacking capacity. Each decision is assessed individually.

twist.text: Involuntary treatment can save lives but strips away fundamental human rightsâ€”a deeply contested practice.

climax.text: The ethical challenge is protecting people who can't protect themselves without taking away everyone's freedom.

punchline.text: Protecting freedom and protecting people can collide.

quiz.question: Does having a mental illness automatically remove medical capacity?
options: No, each decision is assessed individually
Yes, all patients with mental illness lose capacity
Only if the illness lasts more than six months
